##NEW CORONAVIRUS DETECTION: Kit Production capacity of 900,000 people per day, daily inspection of 10,000 people laboratory will be completed

Micro signal

Function introduction, the official account of tecent science and technology of tecent news banner, read technology here!

Source: Periscope

By Pu Xiang

One of the early contradictions in the fight against COVID-19 was that the test kits did not have enough capacity to quickly distinguish true from false patients and identify patients. To resolve this contradiction, as of January 31, the State Drug Administration had approved seven COVID-19 nucleic acid testing reagents in an emergency manner, according to the State Drug Administration's website, to increase reagent production and supply to the community.

A staff member of the State Drug Administration told periscope: "The data we have here is that the seven combined have a production capacity of nearly 900,000 or more kits per day. "

As to whether these kits can be quickly dispatched to the front line, for diagnosis, to meet the use? "At the moment we don't know how many [900,000 people ] they are measuring every day. "

The Ministry of Industry and Information Technology said at a press conference on the morning of February 3 that the daily production of nucleic acid testing reagents for the COVID-19 had reached 773,000 people on February 1,40 times the number of people suspected of having the disease, and had basically met the requirements.

##

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
The pursuit of detection speed leaves Hidden Dangers

After the city was declared closed on January 20 in Wuhan, Hubei Province, Huanggang, Xiaogan and other places, the test kits used to confirm the diagnosis were in short supply, and a large number of patients lingered outside the hospital doors, unable to be diagnosed in time. In this case, January 24, New Year's Eve, many parts of the country in the mobilization, to the Hubei region distribution kits.

Earlier, when people in some parts of Hubei Province mentioned "reagent box" , their tone was a little excited. "The shortage of reagent boxes directly affects the diagnosis of cases. " On social networks, people asked for help more and more.

At the same time as the test kit clenched, the news of raising the speed of diagnosis appeared sometimes, even appeared excessive pursuit of speed undesirable phenomenon.

On January 30th it was announced that the COVID-19's testing time was expected to be cut to less than an hour. "development of 2019-nCov Rapid Test Kit" , a project led by the Chongqing University, the research focuses on the rapid extraction, rapid detection and high throughput (that is, dozens or even hundreds of samples can be processed in a single time) of COVID-19 nucleic acids, establish a rapid screening system for patients and develop a kit. At present, the project team has successfully developed 2019-nCov rapid test kit samples, has been in Chongqing CDC and Chongqing Public Health Center for clinical validation.

The next day, Yangguang News posted on its wechat account that "the diagnosis has been accelerated! The Test Kit with 30-minute results has been approved, " according to a statement posted on the public account of the wechat account. This is the COVID-19 nucleic acid test kit of Shengxiang Biotechnology Co. , Ltd. . After the reader pointed out, CCTV News micro-signal operator corrected the statement, said Sheng Xiang this test kit (fluorescent PCR) products, not 30 minutes out of the test results of the product.

Some people claim that 8-15 minutes to confirm the development of a new coronavirus nucleic acid kit.

During the race against the outbreak, there was a mix-up in the kit. To this, a staff member of BGI expresses concern to"periscope".

On January 26, BGI and BGI, two products of BGI and BGI of BGI OF BGI of BGI group (BGI) , were developed as a COVID-19 Kit and a DNBSEQ-T7 sequencing system, the State Food and Drug Administration has been approved, becoming the first officially approved testing product to combat the outbreak.

"Periscope" called the State Food and Drug Administration, a staff member answered the phone, he said, has been concerned about the market "mixed" kit phenomenon. The State Food and Drug Administration Approves COVID-19 kits that take two to three hours to complete testing, from sample extraction to completion of all tests, using a fluorescent PCR method. "We have also seen reports of products that have taken more than 10 minutes to be tested, but these products have not been declared on our side at present, so we do not know exactly how they work or what methodologies they use. "

Currently, in the emergency situation of epidemic situation, the staff member of the Drug Administration said, "We don't need approval for any CDC product to be used in an emergency response to an outbreak; we need approval for routine use, for diagnostic reagents like those routinely used in medical facilities. "

An industry insiders to "periscope" analysis, Shengxiang biotechnology was approved the same conventional fluorescent PCR products, the entire time required for about 2 hours. At present, the diagnostic POCT platform is a capillary fluorescence quantitative model, which needs special capillary consumables. It claims that the detection results are available in 30 minutes, but does not mention the whole reaction time.

The most important characteristic of PCR is real-time, the time when the sample is positive is related to the concentration of the sample. According to the theory, as long as the concentration of the sample is high, the result can be achieved in 30 minutes by the conventional fluorescent quantitative PCR, if the reverse transcription time is short, would be even shorter. But this will cause the pursuit of speed at the same time, resulting in a reduction in efficiency, that is, the low concentration of samples missed.

The person in the industry said, "The current epidemic is serious, asymptomatic or mild cases of low concentrations in the body, if the pursuit of rapid reaction, may result in missed detection. The use of molecular POCT requires context, first for home use or privacy concerns, and second for bedside use. "It's a public health event, there are large numbers of samples in every health care facility, there are high-throughput solutions, there are many problems to be solved, not fast ones. "

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Where do false positives and omissions come from

In fact, Miss Detection, error detection has attracted attention. Several clinicians questioned the accuracy of the kit. Although "missed detection" is a small probability event, but to ensure the high accuracy of kit results is still of great significance for epidemic prevention and control. According to a Jan. 30 report in the People's Daily, a COVID-19 patient in Tianjin tested negative for nucleic acid three times on Jan. 25 and Jan. 28, but was positive in the fourth test on Jan. 30.

Why is it that the first three tests are negative and the fourth is positive? The PCR method needs a professional laboratory and is operated by a professional. This is a very delicate process, and it may be interfered with by a number of factors. Sample collection, for example, is a key factor.

If the sample is contaminated, or if sputum is not collected from the deep respiratory tract, the viral load is low, the actual detection sensitivity is not measured, or the extraction process is not standardized, etc. , all of these factors are likely to influence the results of the tests.

Experts have also provided some examples. Li Lanjuan, an academician of the Chinese Academy of Engineering and a member of the National Health Commission's High Level Expert Group, has said that in some cases the virus may not be present in the sputum at an early stage, so it can not be detected. In fact, it is difficult to achieve 100% of the detection reagent from the methodology.

In the Health Council issued a diagnosis and treatment plan, clearly stated that reagent test results, to fully consider, together with the epidemiology and clinical performance of a comprehensive decision.

How long does it take for a patient to be diagnosed? There are a number of medical protocols that need to be considered, including epidemiology, past outbreaks, exposure to infectious patients, and clinical manifestations.

In view of the possible problems in the collection, handling, transportation or preservation of the specific test, the manufacturer, in the COVID-19 nucleic acid test kit, in the "limitations of the test method, " Note that a variety of factors can lead to false Yang, false yin.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
The Laboratory for daily examination of 10,000 cases is nearing completion

According to the State Food and Drug Administration staff, the market COVID-19 detection, diagnosis roughly divided into two methods. The latest information released by the official website of the COVID-19 on January 29 shows that its development of the 2019-nCoV nucleic acid isothermal amplification rapid detection kit can produce results in 8-15 minutes, the test time is greatly reduced, and the results can be read automatically by the isothermal amplification instrument.

The FDA currently approves a fluorescent quantitative PCR method, which is defined by the COVID-19 in its guidelines and guidelines for the diagnosis and treatment of diseases. It takes two to three hours for this method to detect the results. "The results in 8-15 minutes may be the adoption of some new methodologies, but these methodologies have not been approved by us, so we can not make a determination as to whether their accuracy and sensitivity meet the standards of the same products, " the FDA official stressed.

A staff member of Bgi told periscope that the accuracy of the PCR test results was related to the richness of the sample data, the quality of the kit and the materials used. A person in the industry revealed that the reagent box storage conditions are harsh, need minus 18 degrees Celsius low temperature, plus materials, the price is not cheap, a sample of reagent box in 100 yuan-200 yuan, the existence of profit space itself is a management challenge from the production, manufacturing and circulation process.

Now, with the release of seven company products approved by the State Food and Drug Administration, the predicament of the three supply kits designated by the CDC in the early days has been resolved. Next, the State Food and Drug Administration said it would continue to approve new kits for companies and products if needed.

Overall pressure is now transmitted downstream, providing more diagnostic laboratories and professionals. Huada genetic staff told "periscope" , a named "Fire Eye" in Wuhan Epidemic Virus Detection Laboratory, will be put into use. The 2,000-square-metre "Fireeye" laboratory, built by the Wuhan and Donghu New Technology Development Zone government with the help of BGI, is nearing completion and can detect 10,000 suspected cases a day.
